examples: ... which had resulted in a number of the older and weaker felons being weeded out in view of the prospective rigours of a lengthy footslog to Siberia.

verbs.description: footslog (third-person singular simple present footslogs, present participle footslogging, simple past and past participle footslogged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) to walk heavily over a long distance or in a weary manner; to trudge
examples: Romans, cursing in full armour, had to fight and footslog two thousand miles overland to Britain.
